text: <http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2015/09/support-for-100mb-apks-on-google-play.html?linkId=17389452>
awwww yeahhh
For 16gb users.....awww no
the app takes up the same amount of space anyway, just before we had to put it in an OBB and make you download it
most of our games here are 50-100 mb, this should simplify things a lot
this seems like it would benefit users with low storage devices imo, for apps under 100mb you’ll see exactly how much storage is required rather than it showing 50mb+
nevermind i guess they show you the full size already
i mean the general trend will be bigger but that’s kind of a natural progress
facebook’s app already pushing the 50mb limit lol
watch it’ll be 99.5 mb a week from now XD
Dude, Android can’t handle Facebooks scale
that’s the real root of the issue
facebook apparently can’t handle facebook’s scale
#facebookdown
I mean, at least they have 2k developers fixing the same problem right now, and since they have mercurial it can actually work
“why query your entire friend graph on the server when we can just store it on the device now?” :smile:
lol
lol
don’t freakin say that. Until we moved off of parse we kept all follow/following relationships on the phone… in memory.
There are so many things in that sentence that make me want to throw up on my keyboard.
android should throw new WtfAreYouDoingException() if you try allocating that much memory in one place

<http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/blogspot/hsDu/~3/NXz4iR_01fs/new-permissions-requirements-for.html|New permissions requirements for Android TV>
Posted by Anirudh Dewani, Developer Advocate

Android 6.0 introduces a new <https://developer.android.com/preview/features/runtime-permissions.html|runtime permission model> that gives users more granular control over granting permissions requested from their apps and leads to faster app installs. Users can also revoke these permissions from Settings at any point of time. If an app running on the M Preview supports the new permissions model, the user does not have to grant any...

<http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/blogspot/hsDu/~3/K0pgpx7w3MA/google-play-services-81-get-ready-for.html|Google Play services 8.1: Get ready for Marshmallow!>
Posted by, Magnus Hyytsten, Developer Advocate

With the rollout of Google Play services 8.1 finally finished, there’s a lot of new information to share with developers about the release!

Marshmallow Permissions

Android 6.0 (Marshmallow) has introduced a new permissions model allowing users to control app permissions at runtime. As an app developer, it’s important for you to adopt this and give your users good control over the permissions your app needs. You can find more details <a...
